intro: Navarretia setiloba, commonly known as the slender navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Navarretia setiloba is known for its delicate appearance and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
